question_stem:

question_stem_html:
Suppose that the file liverpool_2223_season.csv has been read into Python as the pandas dataframe liverpool. The first few rows of the data are given below:

Date Day Venue GF GA Opponent
2022-08-06 Sat Away 2 2 Fulham
2022-08-15 Mon Home 1 1 Crystal Palace
2022-08-22 Mon Away 1 2 Manchester Utd
2022-08-27 Sat Home 9 0 Bournemouth
2022-08-31 Wed Home 2 1 Newcastle Utd
2022-09-03 Sat Away 0 0 Everton
2022-10-01 Sat Home 3 3 Brighton
2022-10-09 Sun Away 2 3 Arsenal
2022-10-16 Sun Home 1 0 Manchester City
2022-10-19 Wed Home 1 0 West Ham

The default index has been created for the dataframe. Which of the following commands can be used to retrieve the first 5 rows (corresponding to August) and only columns GF, GA and Opponent?

items.part_stem_html:
Suppose that the file liverpool_2223_season.csv has been read into Python as the pandas dataframe liverpool. The first few rows of the data are given below:

Date Day Venue GF GA Opponent
2022-08-06 Sat Away 2 2 Fulham
2022-08-15 Mon Home 1 1 Crystal Palace
2022-08-22 Mon Away 1 2 Manchester Utd
2022-08-27 Sat Home 9 0 Bournemouth
2022-08-31 Wed Home 2 1 Newcastle Utd
2022-09-03 Sat Away 0 0 Everton
2022-10-01 Sat Home 3 3 Brighton
2022-10-09 Sun Away 2 3 Arsenal
2022-10-16 Sun Home 1 0 Manchester City
2022-10-19 Wed Home 1 0 West Ham

The default index has been created for the dataframe. Which of the following commands can be used to retrieve the first 5 rows (corresponding to August) and only columns GF, GA and Opponent?
items.solution: When using integer indexing (iloc), we cannot use column (e.g. 'GA' etc.) names to subset.
items.solution_html: When using integer indexing (iloc), we cannot use column (e.g. 'GA' etc.) names to subset.
